meanings.definition: The state or condition of being imminent.
meanings.sent1: The imminence of the storm made everyone seek shelter.
meanings.sent2: The imminence of the deadline motivated him to work harder.
meanings.sent3: The imminence of the cake being ready made the children gather around the oven in excitement.
meanings.sent4: The imminence of the train's arrival was signaled by the distant sound of its horn.
meanings.sent5: The imminence of the sunrise painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being about to happen.
meanings.sent1: The imminence of the concert filled her with anticipation.
meanings.sent2: The imminence of the test made him study late into the night.
meanings.sent3: The imminence of the weekend brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: The imminence of the decision weighed heavily on his mind.
meanings.sent5: The imminence of the first snowfall made the children giddy with excitement.
